name: GraphicsDevice
comment:
Handles creation of graphics resources, and context creation.

A lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice is created from a surface contained in a CanvasElement with which it can render to. All lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsResources are created by a lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.

Additionally a lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsContext is created by the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice. The context is then used to perform all rendering to the surface.

graphicsContext.name: graphicsContext
graphicsContext.comment:
The lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsContext associated with the device.

This functions as an immediate context meaning all calls are sent directly to the GPU rather than creating a command list that is then processed.

capabilities.name: capabilities
capabilities.comment: The lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDeviceCapabilities describing what GPU features are available.

frontBufferWidth.name: frontBufferWidth
frontBufferWidth.comment:
The actual width of the drawing buffer.

This may differ from the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.surfaceWidth if the implementation is unable to satisfy the requested width.

frontBufferHeight.name: frontBufferHeight
frontBufferHeight.comment:
The actual height of the drawing buffer.

This may differ from the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.surfaceHeight if the implementation is unable to satisfy the requested height.

onResourceCreated.name: onResourceCreated
onResourceCreated.comment:
Event handler for when lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsResources are created.

By subscribing to the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.onResourceCreated and lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.onResourceDestroyed events it can be verified that all resources are properly disposed of.

onResourceDestroyed.name: onResourceDestroyed
onResourceDestroyed.comment:
Event handler for when lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsResources are destroyed.

By subscribing to the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.onResourceCreated and lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.onResourceDestroyed events it can be verified that all resources are properly disposed of.

constructors.comment:
Initializes an instance of the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice class.

A lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.RenderingContext is created from the given lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.GraphicsDevice-.surface. Additionally an optional instance of lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDeviceConfig can be passed in to control the creation of the underlying frame buffer.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.GraphicsDevice.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
